intro: Rhodocolea boivinii, commonly known as the Boivin's rhodocolea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
